intro: Oncostemum pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
